snippet: For Dasani, life as one of New York City’s 22,000 homeless children means that innocence is threatened at every turn.
abstract: Dasani, one of New York City's homeless children, works to keep her homelessness hidden; she has spent years of her childhood in the punishing confines of the Auburn shelter in Brooklyn, where to be homeless is to be powerless; experience has left Dasani internally adrift, for the losses of the homeless child only begin with the home itself (Series: Invisible Child).

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Rebecca R. Ruiz, and research by Ms. Ruiz, Joseph Burgess, Alain Delaquérière and Ramsey Merritt.

lead_paragraph: For Dasani, life as one of New York City’s 22,000 homeless children means that innocence is threatened at every turn.

headline.main: Finding Safety and Strength in the Bonds of Her Siblings
headline.print_headline: Finding Safety and Strength in the Bonds of Her Siblings
